definition: Humboldt
surname Hong
flood/big/great
an earthwork/castle/position of defense/stronghold/used in place names, often as phonetic bao for "burg" or "bad"
variant of 鋪|铺[pu4]/used in place names

sentences.english: Chinese Students & Scholars Society The Ohio State University …
sentences.chinese: 柏林洪堡大学中国学生指导手册。

sentences.english: The Count is the gent in the Homburg, on the right of the driver.
sentences.chinese: 计数是根特，在洪堡，在右边的驱动程序。

sentences.english: There were no immediate reports of injuries, according to the U.S. Coast Guard in Humboldt County.
sentences.chinese: 据洪堡郡美国海岸警卫队称，还没有接到伤亡报告。

sentences.english: Linguistic world view is among the main content of Humboldt's linguistic thoughts while linguistic experientialism is the philosophic foundation of modern cognitive linguistics.
sentences.chinese: 语言世界观是洪堡特语言学思想的一个重要内容。

sentences.english: Both Cai Yuanpei and Alexander von Humboldt are well-known educationalists.
sentences.chinese: 蔡元培和洪堡都是著名的高等教育家。
的确，洪堡的遣词用字是无可指责的。

definition: Alfred Wegener (1880-1930), German meteorologist and geophysicist, the originator of the theory of continental drift

Aristotle (384-322 BC), Greek philosopher

Wittgenstein (name)
Leibnitz (name)/Gottfriend Wilhelm von Leibniz (1646-1716), German mathematician and philosopher, co-inventor of the calculus
Carl Linnaeus/Carl Linné
St Augustine/Aurelius Augustinus (354-430), theologian and Christian philosopher/Sankt Augustin, suburb of Beuel, Bonn, Germany
Friedrich (name)
René Descartes (1596-1650), French philosopher and author of Discours de la méthode 方法論|方法论
Mikolaj Kopernik or Nicolaus Copernicus (1473-1543), Polish astronomer, mathematician and polymath
Charles Darwin (1809-1882), British biologist and author of "On the Origin of Species" 物種起源|物种起源[Wu3 zhong3 Qi3 yuan2]/Darwin, capital of the Northern Territory (Australia) 北領地|北领地[Bei3 Ling3 di4]
René Descartes (1596-1650) French philosopher
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Marx (name)
Karl Marx (1818-1883), German socialist philosopher, political activist and founder of Marxism
